job_title: Adjunct Faculty in West Lafayette, IN
pros: Flexible hours Pay per Course
cons: Don’t get the same course to teach consistently

job_title: Student Success Manager in Fort Lauderdale, FL
pros: Direct managers are pretty willing to work with your schedule
cons: Micromanaged via technology monitoring software

job_title: Adjunct Professor in Chicago, IL
pros: Don’t have to build the assignments/curriculum yourself, other professors are great, eager and ready to learn students
cons: Big class sizes (25-35 students), some classes are not prepared for professors ahead of time,

job_title: Sales Advisor in Tampa, FL
pros: Management is nice and friendly
cons: If management doesn't know how to help you, they just go to Kaplopedia. Not very helpful at times. It was a struggle to assist and to advise the students.

job_title: Faculty in Chicago, IL
pros: There are some nice co workers
cons:
The management does not care at all. Demands grow every year for unpaid tasks for full time adjuncts, , meetings, unpaid help on course revisions, calls, and salary never changes, and is very low. 
60% of students come in completely unprepared for basic college level work, think community college, yet we are expected to basically harass them weekly about their work and the college won’t even make a basic student orientation mandatory, so they can at least know how to navigate the online classroom. It’s demented. They really have no interest in the students other than getting a positive review and taking their money. 
Department chairs are a joke. One is so lazy and nasty but she ‘goes way back’ with the Dean of this particular school from ‘their Chicago days’ so she has job security. Another one constantly tells  her department about the expensively vacations she goes on with her husband, because she ‘needs a break’ during their recent massive layoffs. She also gossips about another instructor who ‘’works for 5 colleges!’ and says she can’t possibly manage that well,  and they don’t want instructors working for other schools. Completely tone deaf to the realities of the working class who don’t have a wealthy husband. During the massive layoffs, the Dean actually sent a flippant email saying how change is inevitable and he knew we would be excited to learn who kept their jobs. ?!? Most unprofessional thing I’ve seen in any company and I’ve seen some doozies. This place is demented in how they run things.

job_title: Full Time Faculty in Naples, FL
pros: Students are trying to change their lives
cons: Very Low Pay far below standard. Excessive work in a virtual world. Teach, grade, design classes, sit on committees.. blah blah blah..Does not respect Diversity. Does not respect DEI. There are no key members of leadership who are Black, Hispanic or Latino. Auxiliary work is exhausting. Faculty cut corners just to get the work done. Classes are stadium size.  It is pretty much relegated to a diploma mill trying to pass itself off as Big Purdue!

job_title: Adjunct Instructor in Ocala, FL
pros: I work from home with lots of flexibility in my schedule. Administration is very supportive and allows me to work independently.
cons: I have nothing negative to say.

job_title: Admissions Representative in Fort Lauderdale, FL
pros: Ability to Get Promoted, Volunteer Opportunities, Gift Giving and Matching...
cons: The usual nepotism, resulting in less competent employees matched to jobs they are not prepared to excel in...

job_title: Academic Tutor in West Lafayette, IN
pros: Professional development opportunities and clear expectations
cons: Poor communication and collaboration between departments

job_title: Department Head in Chattanooga, TN
pros: Great students and dedicated, engaged faculty and curriculum developers.
cons: Clueless, elitist leadership --> under-resourced, chaotic operations.

review_title: It's not a good place to be
job_title: Communication Faculty in Chicago, IL
pros: Some of the other faculty members are great people invested in teaching well.
cons: It never seemed like a real college despite the 'Purdue' name and it was a lot more like a for-profit mill. The admins are silly people who don't hold the job long and waste far too much time with meetings that allow them to hog the agenda. One of the admins was so silly with her "fun" music. Classes keep getting bigger and everyone seems to be asked to do more work with no bump in salary. It reminded me of retail work.

job_title: Student Success Manager in Fort Lauderdale, FL
pros: The co-workers were great to work with. Great employee benefits
cons: The salary varied for every employee doing the same work and tasks. There were no pay increase for over a year.

review_title: Was too long ago to be relevent
job_title: Marketing Director in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: Glassdoor requires to write a review of a previous employer. My previous employer was Kaplan Educational Ctrs. which does not exist anymore, since it was taken over by Purdue. So whatever I have to say is not relevant, but I'll say it.
cons: There wasn't enough money in the budget to support more than one person in the office so there were no sick days allowed. Gave me a lot of experience and a great title, but the money was horrible. What did I expect from my first job out of college?

job_title: Admissions Representative in Orlando, FL
pros: Assisted with the admissions process.
cons: More od a sales position.

job_title: Full-time Faculty Member in Indianapolis, IN
pros: The best part are the students; they are great!
cons: Poor leadership. Unethical administration. Horrible pay.

job_title: Faculty Adjunct in West Lafayette, IN
pros:
--You can work independently with little supervision.
--Pay is decent compared to other online faculty jobs.
cons:
--Not much room for advancement. 
--Competitive in terms of getting an job.

review_title: smart team, profit motive challenging for education
job_title: Vice President in Palm Beach, FL
pros: smart colleagues, valid mission to provide affordable career ed
cons: changing leadership, profit motive in education creates problematic inducements to students who may not benefit

job_title: Student Success Manager in Chicago, IL
pros: the pay was not that bad and it was remote
cons: It was a typical sales job

job_title: Student Advisor in Fort Lauderdale, FL
pros: Nice people, good atmosphere, nice corporate events.
cons: lots of work, no appreciation

job_title: Adjunct Instructor in South Bend, IN
pros: Students are interesting and varied. Flexible schedule, except for 1 hour a week. Curriculum is provided.
cons: Lots of grading required. Too much work for the money.

job_title: Student Advisor in Fort Lauderdale, FL
pros: You'll meet some great people on the lower pay scale. As you go higher up, not so much. Many of the skills you will learn, will benefit you in your future career.
cons: Low pay for the work that is required/expected. Little potential for promotion. Will not feel supported by superiors. Students are pretty much allowed to get away with anything, until it affects someone with more power than you. That is where the line is drawn. Also, employees in the same position with the same experience can have 10s of thousands of dollars difference in annual salary. Very discouraging.

job_title: Adjunct Professor in Dagsboro, DE
pros: Nice supervisor, helpful via email when needed.
cons: For teaching courses, then pay a minimal stupend for up to 35 students. But then, they load your courses with 45-46 students - so you'll be teaching at least 10 or so students for free (which 10 qualifies as a second section on their scale). So - in the end - it's teach one section for minimal pay, and teach one extra section for free (35+ another 10-12). If they cap the pay scale at 35 students, then enrollment should be capped at 35 students as well. They do not value their part time faculty at all. No raises for those who stayed and were faithful and did good work. Others received annual raises - not for part timers after one year! No incentive to stay. Avoid.

job_title: Product Owner in Fort Lauderdale, FL
pros: Opportunities to think and contribute independently
cons: Operations employees are underpaid compared to others in the industry

review_title: Great for adjuncts, but it's still adjunct
job_title: Adjunct Professor in Fairfax, VA
pros: Good pay and good infrastructure. Competent leaders.
cons: Not much room for growth. This true across all of academia, however.

job_title: Academic Advisor in Milwaukee, WI
pros:
flexible schedule
can be rewarding at times helping students
great campus boss/lead
great education benefits
cons:
Poor company leadership and communication
not the best workforce ethics
not much opportunity for promotion or advancement
lack of onboarding and overall training support / professional development opps
inconsistent SOPS
can be stressful
often feels like working at a call center instead of advising support

job_title: Web Developer/CMS Developer in Chicago, IL
pros: Working at Purdue Global is wonderful. The teams are great and the workload is easy.
cons: Nothing to comment on because I love it so much.

job_title: Career Specialist in Chicago, IL
pros: Decent pay for entry level, build experience working with students from all across the nation, there are a lot of tasks to juggle so you build on time management and prioritizing tasks, encouraged to become a sme for your field.
cons: Not to much opportunity for growth, a little bit of a glass ceiling with regards to management opportunity.

job_title: Academic Advisor in Chicago, IL
pros: Felt decent job security while working here, good people.
cons: If you get on the wrong team you might not be as happy with the day to day management as it does vary between schools. Not much challenge once you learn the specifics. Limited growth potential.

job_title: Admissions Advisor in Fort Lauderdale, FL
pros: It's a nice place to work.
cons: The work schedules were not too flexible.

review_title: Must be White and Blonde to get a job in Management
job_title: Full Time Faculty in Atlanta, GA
pros: It is a paycheck. Management is not fair.
cons: Too many to list. Salary is too low, Work load is too much. Completely underappreciated. There is no Diversity in Management! Running joke is you must be blonde haired and blue eyed to be a manager of faculty at Purdue Global.

job_title: Student Success Manager in Fort Lauderdale, FL
pros: Opportunity to help people change their lives through education makes the job meaningful. Goals and metrics are given monthly and you manage your time to meet them.
cons: Workload and responsibilities can change often depending on company direction.

job_title: Clinical Student Manager in London, England
pros: Flexible work times, supportive, encouraged professional development.
cons: Students were difficult at times, and leadership did not always follow and enforce the developed policy which lead to increased difficulty.

job_title: Instructor in West Lafayette, IN
pros:
Great people
Good pay
Students are there to learn
cons: Benefits are expensive (health insurance premiums are high)

job_title: Associate Director of Admissions in West Lafayette, IN
pros: Orlando staff is like family. Very friendly people. I loved working there. I would recommend it to anyone looking into this field.
cons: Nothing additional to add to this review other than weekend hours aren't great. Schedule should be more family oriented and friendly.

job_title: Director, Admissions Management in Fort Lauderdale, FL
pros: People, training, vacation time, benefits
cons: Lack of priorities, long hours, continuous change

job_title: Account Executive in Chicago, IL
pros: great staff and communication skills
cons: could be more uplifting office environment

job_title: Admissions Advisor in Fort Lauderdale, FL
pros: I grew to love to work with my coworkers before the pandemic. Afterwards it was hard to connect.
cons: The goals set are unrealistic with the leads you receive.

job_title: Department Chair in Hyderābād
pros: Good people working in most departments.
cons: Low pay compared to similar companies.

job_title: Student Finance Advisor in Chicago, IL
pros: Employee inclusion, work from home, diversity, great pay
cons: Lack of raises, Not enough personal days

job_title: Admissions Representative in Chicago, IL
pros: Met some really awesome people there.
cons: Management has more boss mentality than leader mentality. Too many meetings. Students are seen as numbers versus actual people.

job_title: Student Relationship Manager in Chicago, IL
pros: I worked with some great people throughout my time at Kaplan. I was allowed remote work which helped tremendously when I had very small kids.
cons: A lot of downsizing over the years with lower enrollments.

job_title: Career Specialist in Chicago, IL
pros: The work is rewarding, I have some autonomy.
cons: Few opportunities for advancement, pay raises/

job_title: Student Advisor in Davenport, IA
pros: Good work life balance and good management at the davenport location
cons: Little opportunity to advance at this company

job_title: Student Success Advisor in Fort Lauderdale, FL
pros: Some nice people work there, and the benefits are good.
cons: They still operate like a for profit institution

job_title: Computer and Information Research Scientist in West Lafayette, IN
pros: It is nice and good workplace to be.
cons: I dont know what to say really.

job_title: Career Services Director in Hagerstown, MD
pros: There to support their students and graduates. Always looking for ways to improve and assist their students. Leadership supports this growth.
cons: Advancement and growth can be limited at times and pay can be improved.

review_title: Unrealistic numbers enlight of the pandemic
job_title: Admissions Advisor in Fort Lauderdale, FL
pros: Work from home, some flexibility in hours.
cons: Unrealistic expectations on numbers, time not in available status,

job_title: Adjuct Professor in Indianapolis, IN
pros: The faculty is very supportive.
cons: The salary should be increased

review_title: Speaks about diversity but it’s not a practice
job_title: Coordinator in Fort Lauderdale, FL
pros: The students and faculty are great!
cons: The staff is diverse but people of color are promoted at a lower rate. When two employees are equal, managers look for ways to boost the preferred employees into leadership positions and the managers find larger areas of improvement for POC.

job_title: Sales Consultant in Phoenix, AZ
pros: Great money while it lasted
cons: Laid off which sucked because i loved it here

job_title: Financial Aid Officer in Chicago, IL
pros: Good benefits and reasonable days off
cons: It’s a regular work place

job_title: Adjunct Professor in New York, NY
pros: People are pleasant and curriculum is well-developed
cons: Training (of which there is a lot) is uncompensated

job_title: Professor in Dallas, TX
pros: Supportive environment. Leading in teaching innovation and technology.
cons: Low salary. Online teaching with lots of grading.

job_title: Full-time Faculty, Online in Indianapolis, IN
pros: the students are overall great
cons: too many in one classroom mandatory weekly seminars, required to teach 3 courses in a term with up to 105 students

job_title: Business Development Manager in Miami, FL
pros: Great Company to work for
cons: No complaints whatsoever so far

job_title: Adjunct Instructor in Topeka, KS
pros: Excellent leaders and community, a very rewarding experience
cons: There are none that I can think of

job_title: Human Resources in Palm Beach Gardens, FL
pros:
Excellent faculty and staff
Very user friendly platform for online learning
cons: Not enough opportunities to meet your coworkers

job_title: Admissions Advisor in Orlando, FL
pros: It was a great environment but like any other company people will not get along with everyone, and because it is a call center there are a lot of co-workers. During the job you get help people who truly needed a degree. However, you MUST meet metrics and be able to recruit the number of students needed for that period. They will work with you if you don't meet expectations, but you must always show you are willing to work hard and deserve the job. Like any other employer, they don't want slackers. One of their biggest benefits is being able to study and obtain a new degree.
cons: It is not good for people who are not sales driven. Expect to work during the weekend. However, if you work hard they will reward you and be able to choose your schedule or work from home.

job_title: Financial Aid Officer in Fort Lauderdale, FL
pros: flexible schedule, benefits but no 401K match, company training, some team building activities, nice teammates but when it comes to numbers everyone is on their own.
cons: Constant micromanagement, employees are overworked, they care more numbers over quality, very high turnover, it seems like they are always hiring but that is due to people always leaving, lots of overtime due to lots of employees leaving the company or missing work for being sick, leaving their job to the others who stay. They have unrealistic expectations and blame the employees for not reaching their goals. Poor management.

review_title: "Great transition job, burn out in the long term"
job_title: Enrollment Advisor in Orlando, FL
pros: Great pay for entry level and not many calls come in so you have a lot of downtime to play with.
cons: Having to push people into online school is hard and not the most ethical job, so meeting your enrollments can be impossible sometimes but management has expectations and metrics.

review_title: Admissions > The Good, The Bad, And the Ugly
job_title: Recruiting/Admissions in Orlando, FL
pros: The compensation is good, Benefits are very good, the actual program is good, and the employees are amazing.
cons: Upper management is unhinged. They are constantly changing the rules with little to know thought being placed as to the effect of their knee jerk policies. "goals" are extremely subjective and are not known until after the fact.

review_title: Good Inside Sales Position with Free Education
job_title: Senior Admissions Advisor in Fort Lauderdale, FL
pros:
- Pay
- Free Education
- Potentiality to work from home
- Inside Sales
- Overtime Offered Frequently
cons:
- Stress From Management To Make Enrollment Numbers
- Enrolled Students Who Will Do A 180 At The Last Minute For No Reason, and Not Start, Making You As The Enrollment Advisor Look As Though You Had Done Something Incorrectly/Wrong.
- No Room For Growth

review_title: They pay little for wanting you to do everything
job_title: Adjunct Faculty in Fort Wayne, IN
pros: Many nice enthusiastic students attend Purdue University Global. They are the best part of the job.
cons: Tons of turnover in the administration. Most of the top admin love to bore you with frequent faculty calls, ask you to do prof development on your nickel, wait until the last minute to give you a class and expect you to be in there nearly every day.

job_title: Admissions in Indianapolis, IN
pros: Decent benefits, offices in different states, good work/life balance.
cons: Purdue Global is serviced by Kaplan so it has a toxic office culture. Only the instructors and Career service employees work for Purdue. Admissions, FA, and student services work for Kaplan. It is one of the worst jobs that I ever had where management likes to insult you to your face. The culture is toxic and it doesn't seem like it will get better in the future.

review_title: Not a bad place to work, but not great
job_title: Student Finance Advisor in Chicago, IL
pros:
Co-workers are friendly and supportive
Hours are standard 8-5
Lots of meals provided by company.
Management very accommodating with time off.
cons:
Standard pay is lower than other institutions.
Management heavy.
Promotions appear to be based on who you know or what team your on. 
Benefits cost rose while pay raises were not given.
Lack of communication between different departments
It is not clear who you are working for.

review_title: Great place to work, amazing management
job_title: Admission Advisor in Orlando, FL
pros: Great pay friendly and helpful coworkers and mangers, great training
cons: Personally, had no experience in the call center setting thought I will never stay but with the support of the management and trainers, I did thrive, going through new policies every few months pit you on edge that is all

job_title: Student Success Coordinator in Fort Lauderdale, FL
pros: You can get you a degree and/or certificate tuition-free (pay taxes and fees).  Good benefits - 401k, employer retirement contribution, paid time off, sick days, personal days, paid time off
cons: Hard to progress/grow. Lots of office politics. High turnover for admissions

job_title: Student Advisor in Chicago, IL
pros: Co-workers and the environment was good; work was casual and not as stressful- I never had to take work home. Work was hourly; so anything over the standard hours was considered "Over Time" (paid time and half)
cons: No growth; micromanagement; really customer service oriented- like try to please them at all costs...

job_title: Admissions Counselor in Fort Lauderdale, FL
pros: Great company to work for!  Pays better than most colleges in area...relaxed atmosphere...wonderful management and support.  Not formal with attire...fun people.
cons: Goals to keep up with...trying to motivate students and sometimes long waits to receive a lead.

job_title: Adjunct Professor in Indianapolis, IN
pros: Supervisors are supportive and provide an abundance of resources for instructors. Students are high quality compared to other online schools.
cons: Metrics are closely monitored, so be prepared to connect to the classroom at least 4-5 days per week.

job_title: Financial Aid Team Lead in Fort Lauderdale, FL
pros: Vacation, sick time, personal time, 401k, pension, work from home option. Good culture, good training, and not a heavy turnover with management
cons: Pay is low and they skip annual raises lately

job_title: Career Specialist in Des Moines, IA
pros: It is a wonderful organization, with a great reputation, and treats their employees very well!
cons: I can't think of any!

review_title: Review is more for Kaplan Univrsity
job_title: Administrative in Plantation, FL
pros: Great benefits to take advantage
cons: Not stable, make sure you have a back up plan

job_title: Admissions Adviser in Fort Lauderdale, FL
pros: Good work environment and benefits
cons: When students cancell enrollment after completing all admissions and enrollment documents.

review_title: Great place to meet nice people
job_title: Student Success Coordinator in Fort Lauderdale, FL
pros: Work with nice people, flexible schedule, good location
cons: Slow Advancement for moving up in the company

review_title: Good place to work if you can look past the finger pointing
job_title: Student Services Advisor in Urbandale, IA
pros: People, work/life balance, coworkers, students
cons: Benefits, PTO, micromanagement of employees

job_title: Director of Web Customer Interactions in Boca Raton, FL
pros: I was able to innovate and promote ideas
cons: Hard to gain directional agreement

job_title: Career Specialist in Des Moines, IA
pros: I loved my time here.
cons: Disconnect between other departments, difficult to get info from other areas

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Fort Lauderdale, FL
pros: Set schedule with consistent days off.
cons: No work/life balance, no chance to change schedule. The students are treated like babies by their advisors so they expect every other department to treat them like babies. This is college not elementary school. Upper departments talk down on you

job_title: Adjunct Faculty in Indianapolis, IN
pros: Leadership communicates well and appreciates feedback
cons: I wish I was working full time

job_title: Adjunct Professor in Fort Lauderdale, FL
pros: Management; Flexibility; Communication; Responsive to concerns
cons: A lot of part-time opportunities, but few full-time

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Lafayette, IN
pros: Can work from home, time is flexible.
cons: I cannot think any for now

job_title: Manager in Indianapolis, IN
pros: Consistent Committed To Student Success
cons: Very Fast paced work environment

job_title: FAO in Boca Raton, FL
pros: Ability to move up is there
cons: integrity of company is horrible

job_title: Business Development Manager in Portland, ME
pros: Good people and flexible work schedule.
cons: Low pay and no direction.

review_title: Don't walk, run from this company
job_title: Admissions Advisor in Orlando, FL
pros: The schedule is consistent at least.
cons: They are a for-profit "university" that costs &76000 for a bachelors degree.
